items.title: Reflection on epistemology using Descartes's Meditations of the First Philosophy
items.paragraph: How do we know, that what we perceive is reliable? By exploring Descartes's method of doubt and his conclusions on mind-body dualism, the essay critiques his approach and considers its lasting impact on modern epistemology.

items.title: Shakespeare's Hamlet
items.paragraph: This essay examines how Hamlet and Laertes fulfils the classical framework of tragedian, and how Laertes becomes a foil to Hamlet.

items.title: Shakespeare's Twelfth Night
items.paragraph: This essay examines cross-dressing and how Shakespeare uses it to explore Elizabethan sexuality and subvert gender roles of his time.

items.title: Health Communication in Screen for Life
items.paragraph: This looks into Singapore's HPB's Screen for Life programme and the effectiveness of its messaging regarding healthcare as a preventative and recurrent process.

items.title: Green Financing
items.paragraph: Short reflection on green financing base on B. van Veelen's essay "Cash Cows? Assembling low-carbon agriculture through green finance".

items.title: Finding value in cryptocurrencies
items.paragraph: An extended musing about cryptocurrencies. And the potential value such decentralised financial networks have to attract investors.
